skill.name: rn-styling
skill.description: Styling patterns for React Native with NativeWind and BrandColors. Use when working with styles, themes, colors, responsive layouts, or platform-specific UI in Expo/React Native.
skill.summary: React Native styling patterns using NativeWind and BrandColors for consistent cross-platform UI development.
skill.author: CJHarmath

security_audit.summary: All 42 static findings are false positives. The scanner misidentified TypeScript code examples (backticks for template literals), React Native platform APIs (Platform.OS, Platform.select), and YAML frontmatter as security issues. This is a legitimate documentation skill with no malicious code or security risks.

content.value_statement: React Native styling differs from web CSS. This skill provides proven patterns for NativeWind, BrandColors, platform-specific styles, and responsive layouts to build consistent cross-platform mobile UI.
actual_capabilities: Apply NativeWind class patterns for layout and spacing in React Native components
Implement BrandColors for semantic color management with light and dark theme support
Handle platform-specific styles for iOS and Android differences
Create responsive layouts using breakpoints and window dimension hooks
Manage safe area and keyboard avoiding behavior in mobile views
Combine animated styles with static styles for smooth transitions
limitations: Does not provide actual BrandColors or design system files - users must create their own
Does not execute code or modify project files directly
Does not integrate with build tools or configuration files
Assumes basic familiarity with React Native and TypeScript

prompt_templates.title: Basic styling question

output_examples.input: Style a card component with brand colors and NativeWind
output_examples.output:
```typescript
import { BrandColors } from '@/constants/BrandColors';

// Hybrid approach: NativeWind for layout, BrandColors for semantic colors
<View className="flex-1 p-4 rounded-lg" style={{ backgroundColor: BrandColors.cardBackground }}>
  <Text className="text-lg font-semibold" style={{ color: BrandColors.textPrimary }}>
    Card Title
  </Text>
</View>
```

best_practices: Use BrandColors for semantic colors (primary, background, text) and NativeWind for layout utilities (padding, margin, flex)
Apply NativeWind class ordering carefully since React Native does not cascade - the last class wins for conflicting properties
Combine style arrays for animated components instead of spreading StyleSheet objects to avoid creating new objects on each render
anti_patterns: Hardcoding hex colors directly in components instead of using BrandColors - this breaks theme consistency
Using NativeWind color classes like bg-blue-500 for brand colors - these should come from BrandColors
Spreading style objects like style={{ ...styles.card, opacity: fadeAnim }} - this creates new objects on each render causing performance issues

faq.question: What is NativeWind and how does it differ from web Tailwind?
faq.answer: NativeWind is a Tailwind CSS port for React Native. It brings utility classes to mobile but does not have full web parity. Some web Tailwind utilities are unsupported, and v2 breakpoints differ from web (sm: 640px, md: 768px, lg: 1024px, xl: 1280px).

faq.question: When should I use StyleSheet.create versus NativeWind classes?
faq.answer: Use StyleSheet for complex reused styles, performance-critical components, and iOS shadows. Use NativeWind for simple layout utilities, one-off styles, and conditional classes. A hybrid approach works best.

faq.question: How do I handle light and dark mode with BrandColors?
faq.answer: Create BrandColors and BrandColorsDark constant files. Use the useColorScheme hook from react-native to detect the current theme and return the appropriate color object. Pass these colors to components via the style prop.

faq.question: Why are my NativeWind classes not applying?
faq.answer: Not all web Tailwind utilities work in NativeWind. Check the NativeWind v2 documentation for supported utilities. Also ensure you are using the className prop (not style) on React Native components.

faq.question: How do I handle safe area on notched devices?
faq.answer: Use SafeAreaView from react-native-safe-area-context with the edges prop, or use useSafeAreaInsets hook for manual control. NativeWind may have safe area utilities if configured.

faq.question: What causes style flicker on mount in React Native?
faq.answer: Style flicker often occurs when styles are applied after the initial render. Use Animated API with useRef for Animated.Value to create smooth transitions instead of immediate style changes.
